message: http://www.bringtolightnyc.org/?page_id=36 - Nuit Blanche is a one-night exhibition of light art, projection art, LED art and interactive sculptures. It takes place in Greenpoint, on the waterfront. It's really well attended. Here are some photos I took last year: http://www.flickr.com/search/?w=58347531@N00&q=nuit%20blanche

I'm going to propose a rear-projected, onto a window, LED matrix ticker, a la stock market and 'breaking news' stories - trying to figure out a way to control a widget from my phone so I can change it dynamically, or have it be a private channel that certain players can change what gets projected, speed, color, etc.
I like this idea! Now I've got to figure out whether or not I can work another project into my schedule... Light celebrations bring back fond memories of being far from the equator in winter.
Something I'm working on could help you, Nick. http://www.boxysean.com/projects/disrupt-hackathon.html
Oh yeah I'll be submitting something, probably LED-based and sculptural and interactive
Pico Projectors are always fun. I wish I had a laser Pico Projector. Damn poverty...
Sounds cool! As soon as my computer finishes this installation, I'm gonna check it out.

have you seen the structured light 3d scans people have been doing with pico projectors and openframeworks? check out kyle mcdonalds stuff on vimeo. ive been getting good results with a crappy logitech webcam and a ryobi line laser from home depot.
Nice. I'm impressed.
@Boxysean You left before I could ask you if you were aware of a software project called VVVV http://vvvv.org/propaganda ?
Nice. I'm impressed.
i just ordered a showwx+ laser pico projector off amazon. ill see how it looks, was debating between that, or the LED optoma pk301. they both have their pros and cons, but ive never used either.
Please tell me how it works out, and, if it doesn't what I could trade/pay you for it!
Nick, I'm not keeping as track as I should with Nuit Blanche, on the RB site all day.  So if I miss some opportunity or something, apologizes in advance.

Matt's project was truly impressive.  I guess the next step is to see how the Kinect does it.  And then maybe seeing what happens if you scan someone through a fresnel screen.  Think you could get more resolution out of it?

@boxysean ahhh thanks! dope! I hadn't even considered a wireless LAN but that's really smart. I'm still mulling my options for Nuit Blanche - between something I already have or something I have to work on (i.e. NO time!).
@A1Ari I stop by, I see you working! it's all good!

@nicknormal successful demo of my project at Share tonight. Some guy in some IRC room told me that the technology is feasible over the web, provided the routing is nice (i.e., get your webhosting in NJ). Well anyways I'm open to helping anybody with my code so just ping me.
@A1Ari I've only heard that vvvv is crazy. Maybe one day will make an excuse to use it. Patching languages are good for prototyping, in my experience, but not sure how they scale up compared to OOP.

3 pico projectors + steam = http://m.engadget.com/default/article.do?artUrl=http://www.engadget.com/2011/03/17/3d-fog-projection-display-brings-purple-bunnies-to-life-just-in/&category=classic&postPage=1
